Judul: EXPLORING AN ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY WASTEWATER TREATMENT FOR BATIK COTTAGE INDUSTRY IN PEKALONGAN CITY: THE CASE OF OZONATION TREATMENT FOR DECOLORIZATION AND BIODEGRADABILITY ENHANCEMENT
Abstrak:
Designating batik as an Indonesian Cultural Heritage in 2009 by UNESCO
increased the demand for batik in Indonesia. Consequently, Indonesia faces serious
environmental problems caused by waste/wastewater generated from the batik
industry. Pekalongan City as one of the biggest batik producers in Central Java,
Indonesia operates three batik biological treatment wastewater treatment plants
(WWTPs). This research focused on investigate current situation and problems of
treatment then evaluated through the effluent quality index (EQI) and compared
with water quality class criteria which is stated by government of Indonesia.
Alternative treatment using ozonation followed by aerobic biological treatment was
also conducted. The EQI indicates that the WWTPs effectively improved the water
quality. The EQI scores of 3 WWTPs’ effluent were comparable to the score of
water resource class II in Indonesia and Banyuurip Village WWPT which is using
anaerobic treatment followed by constructed wetland was the most effective for
batik wastewater treatment. Alternative treatment systems combining
physicochemical processes and biological processes will be needed by local
government of Pekalongan city for the batik industry in future.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Ir. Teti Armiati Argo, MES, Ph.D.
Fakultas: Sekolah Arsitektur, Perencanaan dan Pengembangan Kebijakan
Kata Kunci: Batik wastewater, Effluent quality index, ozonation, biological treatment, activated sludge
